intro: Ocimum siphonanthum, commonly known as Indian basil or holy basil, is a member of the Lamiaceae family. It is an aromatic herb native to the Indian subcontinent and is characterized by its small, fragrant leaves and purple or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The essential oils extracted from the plant contain compounds like eugenol and limonene, contributing to its medicinal and culinary uses.
